messages.content: According to the provided context, the importance of HR Policy is that it is a statement of strategies on HR functions and for developing the standards of practices, behavior, and boundaries to meet specific goals. It caters to the running of an organization on a successful business and paves the way to achieve its goal. The HR Policy provides direction in the growth of the organization and management of employees, enabling clarity and norming of practices on various issues related to HR management. It also works as a guide to standardization on various aspects of quality services, skill development, and performance appraisal through systems and processes. Additionally, it eliminates adhocism on employees' related issues, rules out ambiguity, and provides a framework to spot and address deviations and violations of standards. Overall, the HR Policy provides a detailed layout of format for best practices in human resource development, promoting a healthy work environment and high standards of morals and performance benchmarks at the workplace.
